roleset.name: make a rebuttal, responding to in support of opposing viewpoint
roleset.note: REBUT-V NOTES: Frames file for 'rebut' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No Verbnet entry, no Framenet entry, which isn't surprising because this is a made-up verb, backformed from"rebuttal". No comparison. (from rebut.01-v predicate notes)
REBUTTAL-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, Wordnet, rebut.01. No VNcls. (from rebuttal.01-n)

roles.note: Verb frame is split into two senses, which are combined into a single sense here. (from rebuttal.01-n)

example.name: transitive
example.text: [Japanese government officials]-1, *trace*-1 eager *trace*-1 to rebut foreign criticism of Japanese investments overseas, hailed the transaction as proof foreigners can make similar investments in Japan.
example.arg: foreign criticism of Japanese investments overseas

example.name: args 0, 1
example.text: And there?s certainly something appealing to his rebuttal that he wants the platform to be a collaborative effort, and not something he?d impose on the party.
example.arg: that he wants the platform to be a collaborative effort, and not something he'd impose on the party

example.name: All args
example.text: John's rebuttal to Mary that he was smarter than she was didn't go over very well.
example.arg: that he was smarter than she was

example.name: Args 2, MNR
example.text: His writings and speeches were such a huge influence on me during those most tumultuous teenage years , the years in which I was " tentatively feeling my way into the life of the freethinker " in the words of Dawkins , and served as a brilliant rebuttal to the dogma I was being fed in Catholic school .
example.arg: to the dogma I was being fed in Catholic school

roleset.name: say as a rebuttal
roleset.note: REBUT-V NOTES: Frames file for 'rebut' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No Verbnet entry, no Framenet entry, which isn't surprising because this is a made-up verb, backformed from"rebuttal". No comparison. (from rebut.02-v predicate notes)

example.name: polytheistic prurience
example.text: `` [The gods seemed [*-1] to think sex pretty important]-2 '' , she rebutted [*T*-2] .
